component.name: jira
component.title: Jira
component.description: The jira component interacts with the JIRA issue tracker.
component.label: api,reporting

delay.description: Time in milliseconds to elapse for the next poll.

jiraUrl.description: The Jira server url, example: http://my_jira.com:8081

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

configuration.label: advanced
configuration.description: To use a shared base jira configuration.

accessToken.label: security
accessToken.description: (OAuth only) The access token generated by the Jira server.

consumerKey.label: security
consumerKey.description: (OAuth only) The consumer key from Jira settings.

password.label: security
password.description: (Basic authentication only) The password to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if username basic authentication is used.

privateKey.label: security
privateKey.description: (OAuth only) The private key generated by the client to encrypt the conversation to the server.

username.label: security
username.description: (Basic authentication only) The username to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if OAuth is not enabled on the Jira server. Do not set the username and OAuth token parameter, if they are both set, the username basic authentication takes precedence.

verificationCode.label: security
verificationCode.description: (OAuth only) The verification code from Jira generated in the first step of the authorization proccess.

type.description: Operation to perform. Consumers: NewIssues, NewComments. Producers: AddIssue, AttachFile, DeleteIssue, TransitionIssue, UpdateIssue, Watchers. See this class javadoc description for more information.

delay.description: Time in milliseconds to elapse for the next poll.

jiraUrl.description: The Jira server url, example: http://my_jira.com:8081

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

jql.label: consumer
jql.description: JQL is the query language from JIRA which allows you to retrieve the data you want. For example jql=project=MyProject Where MyProject is the product key in Jira. It is important to use the RAW() and set the JQL inside it to prevent camel parsing it, example: RAW(project in (MYP, COM) AND resolution = Unresolved)

maxResults.label: consumer
maxResults.description: Max number of issues to search for

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

accessToken.label: security
accessToken.description: (OAuth only) The access token generated by the Jira server.

consumerKey.label: security
consumerKey.description: (OAuth only) The consumer key from Jira settings.

password.label: security
password.description: (Basic authentication only) The password to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if username basic authentication is used.

privateKey.description: (OAuth only) The private key generated by the client to encrypt the conversation to the server.

username.label: security
username.description: (Basic authentication only) The username to authenticate to the Jira server. Use only if OAuth is not enabled on the Jira server. Do not set the username and OAuth token parameter, if they are both set, the username basic authentication takes precedence.

verificationCode.label: security
verificationCode.description: (OAuth only) The verification code from Jira generated in the first step of the authorization proccess.
